snippet.textDisplay: Enix didn't make this game, however Yuji Horii and akira toiyama, both of Dragon Quest fame, which was an enix game, did write and design the characters for the game, respectivly.  These guys, plus Sakaguchi, Kitase, Uematsu, no wonder this game was created by what they called the DREAM TEAM

snippet.textDisplay: This is easily the best dungeon theme in the game. It's so deep that it's hard to believe it's from the SNES. I wish I could give Mitsuda, my hero, credit for it, but Nobuo hit it out of the park with this one.
snippet.textOriginal: This is easily the best dungeon theme in the game. It's so deep that it's hard to believe it's from the SNES. I wish I could give Mitsuda, my hero, credit for it, but Nobuo hit it out of the park with this one.

snippet.textDisplay: This is my favourite dungeon theme of Chrono Trigger.  The only flaw being that the battle music would interrupt the theme.  In Giant's Claw this wasn't the case.  This music definitely fits the situation of Ayla's tribe.  They were about to be exterminated and this concluded with the final struggle with Azala and the Black Tyranno.  I also enjoyed the bit of character development on Azala accepting the fate of her species dying.
snippet.textOriginal: This is my favourite dungeon theme of Chrono Trigger.  The only flaw being that the battle music would interrupt the theme.  In Giant's Claw this wasn't the case.  This music definitely fits the situation of Ayla's tribe.  They were about to be exterminated and this concluded with the final struggle with Azala and the Black Tyranno.  I also enjoyed the bit of character development on Azala accepting the fate of her species dying.

snippet.textDisplay: One of the couple songs composed by Uematsu. He definitely reused the same structure for Final Fantasy IX's Dark Messenger, with the same kind of heavy style, buildup and calm break in the middle.
snippet.textOriginal: One of the couple songs composed by Uematsu. He definitely reused the same structure for Final Fantasy IX's Dark Messenger, with the same kind of heavy style, buildup and calm break in the middle.
